maml:description.maml:para: Install a font from file path using CSharp code, compatitable fonts are available for use within the console font list.
Path of Font File, can accept multiple font files Supported File Types - .ttc, .ttf, .fnt, .otf, .fon
Path of Font File, can accept multiple font files Supported File Types - .ttc, .ttf, .fnt, .otf, .fon
Add text to the bottom of current ISE File
Covert a path in between the Windows and the WSL path formats
Convert Path from Windows format to WSL format - Default
Convert Path from WSL format to Windows format
Convert Path from WSL format to Windows format
Convert Path from Windows format to WSL format - Default

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: # Convert Windows Path to WSL Convert-WSLPath -Path 'C:\temp\'

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: # Convert WSL Path to Windows Convert-WSLPath -Path '/usr/bin/ssh' -ToWindows

maml:description.maml:para: Get a summary of a folder ACL
This command will examine the ACL of a given folder and create a custom object.
The object will include a count of access rules based on the identity
reference. Any ACL that belongs to a builtin or system account, or Everyone and
Creator Owner, will be counted as a SystemACL. Everything else will be counted
as a UserACL. You might use this information to identify folders or files where
The custom object also contains an AccessRules property which will be a
collection of the access rules for that object.
It is assumed you will use this with the FileSystem provider.
This version of the command uses a format file which is loaded "on the fly" so by default,
information is presented as a nicely formatted table without the AccessRules property.
The path of the folder to analyze. The default is the current directory.
The path of the folder to analyze. The default is the current directory.

maml:alert.maml:para: NAME : Get-ACLInfo VERSION : 0.9 LAST UPDATED: 6/21/2012 AUTHOR : Jeffery Hicks (http://jdhitsolutions.com/blog)

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-ACLInfo D:\Files Get acl data on the Files folder.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-ChildItem e:\groups\data -Recurse | Where-Object {$_.PSIsContainer} | Get-ACLInfo Get acl information for every folder under e:\groups\data.

maml:description.maml:para: Get the code of a powershell function or filter

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: # Gets the code for New-Guid Get-FunctionCode New-Guid

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: # Outputs the code for New-Guid into a new PowerShell ISE Tab Get-FunctionCode -Function New-Guid -OutISE

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: # Gets the code for New-Guid and saves it to V:\temp\New-Guid.ps1 Get-FunctionCode New-Guid -OutFile V:\temp\New-Guid.ps1

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: # Outputs the code for New-Guid into a new PowerShell ISE Tab and saves it to V:\temp\New-Guid.ps1 Get-FunctionCode -Function New-Guid -OutISE -OutFile V:\temp\New-Guid.ps1

maml:description.maml:para: Uses git.exe to clone the gists and repositories of a github user.
Can Exclude repositories with names that match the string/strings defined with -Exclude
I included the source file for PForEach because it is no longer visible in the powershellgallery and github
Param2 help - Directory to save User Gists and Repositories
Param3 help - Exclude Repositories with Names matching these strings
Param3 help - Exclude Repositories with Names matching these strings
Param2 help - Directory to save User Gists and Repositories
Trims single and double quotes from path stored in clipboard then passes results to Get-Item
Designed for taking the clipboard contents from Windows Explorer "Copy Path" into PowerShell.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $test = Get-Credential # Username - Tester, Password test1 $test.Password | Get-StringFromSecureString

Generate ANSI escape code string for outputing text with color
Create ANSI color escape code using a RGB color value

maml:alert.maml:para: FYI: Remeber to reset the text style after every stylized text, otherwise the ANSI effects will continue to be applied to all that get output later.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: # Create variable with desired color $ANSI1 = New-ANSIString # Create variable to reset ANSI effects $Reset = New-ANSIString -Reset # String getting colored $Text = 'This is a test. More testing... and testing'

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: # Create variable with desired foreground color $ANSIFG1 = New-ANSIString -Red 55 -Green 120 -Blue 190 -Foreground # Create variable with desired background color $ANSIBG1 = New-ANSIString -Green 100 -Background # Create variable to reset ANSI effects $Reset = New-ANSIString -Reset # String getting colored $Text = 'This is a test. More testing... and testing' $Text2 = 'More and more and more!'

maml:alert.maml:para: assumes notepad++.exe is within $env:PATH Install with chocolatey if needed

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: ### BAD EXAMPLE - funciton is stupid and will open all resolved paths gci .\* | Open-NotepadPlusPlus

Displays a progress bar within a Windows PowerShell command window.
The Write-Progress cmdlet displays a progress bar in a Windows PowerShell command window that depicts the status of a running command or script.
Object use in your foreach processing
Specifies an ID that distinguishes each progress bar from the others.
Specifies the parent activity of the current activity.
Specifies an ID that distinguishes each progress bar from the others.
Object use in your foreach processing
Specifies the parent activity of the current activity.

maml:alert.maml:para: File Name : Write-MyProgress.ps1 Author : Woz Date : 2017-05-10 Last Update : 2023-01-14 Version : 2.0.0

dev:remarks.maml:para:
$Count = 0 $StartTime = Get-Date foreach($Process in $GetProcess) { $Count++ Write-MyProgress -StartTime $StartTime -Object $GetProcess -Count $Count
Write-Host "-> $($Process.ProcessName)" Start-Sleep -Seconds 1 }
